on diabetic gangrene diabetics possess
distinct problems which make their limbs
more liable to gangrene formation mainly
three factors play major roles one
sugar-laden tissues of the diabetics
lower their resistance to infection
after trivial injury to the toe or sole

is important to note that in patients

arteries proximal to the popliteal

and there may be abscess formation both

frequently in old diabetic patients dry

infection factor is minimum and the
occlusive factor of the artery is

is more often seen in younger diabetics
